intro: Isoloma triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered rock rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers clustered in threes. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Isoloma triflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
